Hello list,

So I've been able to successfully get Heritrix crawling my seed URLs  
by configuring jobs via the web UI. Now I'd like to get jobs started  
in an automated way. To my understanding my options are either to use  
JMX or to start crawls from the CLI. So I have these questions:

1. Where is the documentation for starting crawls from the command  
line? It appears there needs to be an "order.xml" file but this file,  
its purpose, its format doesn't appear to be documented anywhere.  
There are order.xml files generated for jobs that are configured via  
the web UI, but attempting to use one of these on the CLI Heritrix  
just quits without doing anything (at all, even in the foreground).

2. Are there any start-to-finish/novice recipes/tutorials for JMX  
control of Heritrix? Specifically with regard to starting a crawl job  
and other job control would be very useful. I quite like this method  
of use because it would allow one instance to run and I could use the  
web UI to monitor progress and details.

Thanks for your time!
- Jesse


P.S. Please copy-all on replies.
